discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Axelos 5.2.16
Each service request may include one or more of the following:
- a request for a service delivery action
- a request for information
- a request for provision of a resource or service
- a request for access to a resource or service
- feedback, compliments, and complaints
When you came this far, good luck with the exam :)

Selected Answer: C
i worked in 4 different service desks and not a single time did we handle a praise as a ticket/SR, it might just as well say spam mails to enlarge your "service offering" can be dealt with as an SR.... but i guess it doesn't need to make with the real world.

Selected Answer: C
5.2.16

- a request for a service delivery action
- a request for information
- a request for provision of a resource or service
- a request for access to a resource or service

questions.question_text: What is CORRECT about service request management?

choices.C: Compliments can be handled as service requests
choices.A: Service requests can be used to restore service
choices.B: Complex service request procedures should be avoided
choices.D: A new procedure is required for each new service request

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
2.4.1 Service relationship management - Joint activities performed by a service provider and a service consumer to ensure continual value co-creation based on agreed and available service offerings

questions.question_text: What ensures that service providers and service consumers continue to create value together?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Ref: 4.3.4.1 "The first and most obvious stakeholder group is the customers. The main goal of a
service provider is to facilitate outcomes that its customers are interested in, so the
customers have a large stake in the service providerâ€™s ability to manage services
effectively"

Selected Answer: B
Customers, so B. 223 should also be B.
Now this same question so repeated again and the right answer have been chosen this time round (Customers )

The most important stakeholder who is quite visible is the customer. The service provider has to ensure delivering outcomes that facilitate the customer to accomplish their goals. To achieve this, there has to be interaction & collaboration across stakeholder groups that include the team, partner & suppliers.

Selected Answer: B
This same question is found in 223 and the answer there is (C) Relationship Managers. I think the right answer is B (Customers)

questions.question_text: What are the KEY stakeholder groups that service providers should cooperate with?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Systematically observe services and service components, and record and report selected changes of state identified as events

This statement accurately represents the purpose of the Monitoring and Event Management practice in ITIL v4. Monitoring and Event Management involves the continual observation of services and service components to detect, analyze, and determine the significance of changes in state (events), ensuring that the services operate effectively and efficiently.

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer

A - Incident management
B - Service request management
C - Monitoring and event management
D - Change management

choices.B: Support the agreed quality of a service by handling all pre-defined, user-initiated service requests in an effective and user-friendly manner
choices.D: Maximize the number of successful service and product changes by ensuring that risks have been properly assessed, authorized and managed within a schedule
choices.A: Minimize the negative impact of incidents by restoring normal service operation as quickly as possible
choices.C: Systematically observe services and service components, and record and report selected changes of state identified as events

questions.question_text: Which statement about the purpose of the Monitoring and event management practice is TRUE?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Ref: 5.2.8
"The purpose of the problem management practice is to reduce the likelihood
and impact of incidents by identifying actual and potential causes of incidents,
and managing workarounds and known errors"

Selected Answer: D
The ITIL 4 Practitioner: Problem Management practice module is for IT professionals who want to reduce the likelihood and impact of incidents by identifying actual and potential causes of incidents and manage workarounds and known errors.

questions.question_text:
Identify the missing word(s) in the following sentence.

The purpose of the problem management practice is to reduce the likelihood and impact of incidents by identifying actual and potential causes of incidents and managing [?] and known errors.
